{"step_by_step_thinking": "To find the minimum haemoglobin level below which 5% of the pregnant females will have their haemoglobin levels, we need to calculate the z-score corresponding to the 5th percentile. The z-score can be calculated using the formula: z = (x - μ) / σ, where x is the value we want to find, μ is the mean, and σ is the standard deviation. In this case, we want to find the value of x. Rearranging the formula, we have x = z * σ + μ. To find the z-score corresponding to the 5th percentile, we can use a standard normal distribution table or a calculator. The z-score corresponding to the 5th percentile is approximately -1.645. Substituting the values into the formula, we have x = -1.645 * 2 + 10.6 = 7.31. Therefore, the minimum haemoglobin level below which 5% of the pregnant females will have their haemoglobin levels is approximately 7.31 g/dL.", "answer_choice": "A"}
